intro: Oxymyrrhine cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf oxymyrrh, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it can tolerate high levels of sunlight and limited water. The essential oils derived from its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.
